body:
Comment 27 by **czarek.tomczak**: 
Many people disable Virtual Memory on Windows to speed their OS. The same for Linux and
its swap. Even if you have 16 GB of free ram, Windows will try to use virtual memory
just to save the space for the future. And this will slow down applications. I've been
running with virtual memory disabled for years and never had any problem with any
applications. But seems like Go is an exception.
